verses.kjv: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
verses.ct: A person who stiffens up after repeated correction will be suddenly broken beyond repair.

verses.kjv: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.
verses.ct: When righteous people are in power, everyone celebrates, but when the wicked rule, the people groan.

verses.kjv: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.
verses.ct: Whoever loves wisdom makes his father proud, but someone who hangs around with prostitutes wastes his wealth.

verses.kjv: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.
verses.ct: A king who rules with justice makes his nation stable, but one who demands bribes tears it apart.

verses.kjv: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.
verses.ct: Someone who flatters his neighbor is setting a trap right at his feet.

verses.kjv: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
verses.ct: An evil person's sin becomes a trap for him, but the righteous person sings and celebrates.

verses.kjv: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.
verses.ct: The righteous person cares about justice for the poor, but the wicked person has no interest in understanding it.

verses.kjv: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.
verses.ct: Mockers stir up an entire city, but wise people calm things down.

verses.kjv: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.
verses.ct: When a wise person takes a fool to court, the fool rages and laughs, and nothing gets resolved.

verses.kjv: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.
verses.ct: Violent people despise those with integrity, but the upright care about protecting their lives.

verses.kjv: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
verses.ct: A fool lets out every thought on his mind, but a wise person holds back and stays composed.

verses.kjv: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.
verses.ct: When a ruler listens to lies, all his officials become corrupt.

verses.kjv: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD lighteneth both their eyes.
verses.ct: The poor person and the oppressor have this in common: the LORD gives sight to both of them.

verses.kjv: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
verses.ct: A king who judges the poor with fairness will have his throne secured forever.

verses.kjv: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
verses.ct: Discipline and correction produce wisdom, but a child left without guidance brings shame to his mother.

verses.kjv: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.
verses.ct: When the wicked increase, sin increases with them, but the righteous will watch them fall.

verses.kjv: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
verses.ct: Discipline your son, and he will give you peace — he will bring joy to your soul.

verses.kjv: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
verses.ct: Without prophetic guidance, people run wild, but whoever obeys the law is blessed.

verses.kjv: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.
verses.ct: A servant won't be corrected by words alone — even if he understands, he won't respond.

verses.kjv: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
verses.ct: Do you see someone who speaks without thinking? There's more hope for a fool than for him.

verses.kjv: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.
verses.ct: If you pamper a servant from childhood, he will eventually expect to be treated like a son.

verses.kjv: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
verses.ct: A hot-tempered person starts fights, and someone quick to anger commits all kinds of sin.

verses.kjv: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
verses.ct: A person's pride will bring him down, but a humble spirit will earn him honor.

verses.kjv: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.
verses.ct: Whoever partners with a thief is his own worst enemy — he hears the oath to testify but says nothing.

verses.kjv: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.
verses.ct: Being afraid of people becomes a trap, but whoever trusts in the LORD will be kept safe.

verses.kjv: Many seek the ruler’s favour; but every man’s judgment cometh from the LORD.
verses.ct: Many people seek a ruler's approval, but true justice for everyone comes from the LORD.

verses.kjv: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
verses.ct: The righteous despise the dishonest, and the wicked despise those who live with integrity.
